meanings.sent1: The tire had a blowout on the highway.
meanings.sent2: The balloon had a blowout and popped loudly.
meanings.sent3: The unexpected blowout of the pipe caused a mess in the kitchen.
meanings.sent4: The blowout of emotions overwhelmed her.
meanings.sent5: The blowout of the dam flooded the entire valley.

meanings.definition: A lopsided victory in a competition
meanings.sent1: The basketball team had a blowout win with a score of 100-50.
meanings.sent2: The blowout in the soccer match was evident as one team scored 6 goals in the first half.
meanings.sent3: The blowout victory left the opposing team in disbelief.
meanings.sent4: The blowout win was a testament to their hard work and skill.
meanings.sent5: The blowout victory secured their spot in the finals.

meanings.definition: A large, informal party or celebration
meanings.sent1: We had a blowout for my birthday with music and dancing.
meanings.sent2: The blowout at the beach was filled with laughter and good food.
meanings.sent3: The blowout turned into a karaoke night with everyone singing their hearts out.
meanings.sent4: The blowout lasted until the early hours of the morning.
meanings.sent5: The blowout was a great way to celebrate our team's success.
